Home → News → New opening times for Glemsford and Thurston libraries

New opening times for Glemsford and Thurston libraries

Glemsford and Thurston libraries are changing their opening hours from Monday 14 September.

Glemsford will be increasing its opening times by two hours and Thurston will be open on two days where it is currently closed. The new times take affect from Monday 14 September and are designed to increase use of the library and benefit local people.

Glemsford Library new hours from Monday 14 September

Day Hours
Monday Closed (no change)
Tuesday 10am to 1pm and 2pm to 5pm (currently 9.30am to 12.30pm and 2pm to 5pm)
Wednesday Closed (no change)
Thursday 10am to 1pm and 2pm to 5pm (currently closed)
Friday 10am to 1pm and 2pm to 5pm (currently 9.30am to 11.30am and 2.30pm to 5pm)
Saturday Closed (currently open 9.30am to 2pm)
Sunday 11am to 3pm (currently open 11am to 4pm)

This amounts to the library being open for an extra two hours a week which is being covered by a restructure of working patterns.

Thurston Library new hours from Monday 14 September

Day Hours
Monday Closed (no change)
Tuesday 3pm to 7pm (currently 10am to 1pm and 3pm to 7pm)
Wednesday 10am to 1pm (currently closed)
Thursday 2pm to 6pm (currently 10am to 1pm and 3pm to 7pm)
Friday 10am to 1pm (currently closed)
Saturday 10am to 3pm (no change)
Sunday 10am to 3pm (no change)

The library will be open the same number of hours but is now open on Wednesdays and Fridays.

Customers at both libraries have been consulted on all these changes which are designed to meet local demand and increase use of the library. The changes have been approved by Suffolk Libraries’ Board and Suffolk County Council.
